senses.de: Something that makes you want to do something or gives you an idea about what to do or create
senses.ex: Her courage was an inspiration to all.

Tips.title: Motivational Trigger
Tips.description: Often used for people, experiences, or events that drive you to start or continue an endeavor.
Tips.example: The athlete's victory speech served as inspiration for my own training.

Tips.title: Creative Boost
Tips.description: Refers to ideas or influences that fuel your creativity, particularly in arts and literature.
Tips.example: The stunning landscape was my inspiration for the painting.

senses.de: The process of being mentally stimulated to do or feel something, especially to do something creative
senses.ex: I'm waiting for inspiration to strike.

Tips.title: Aha! Moments
Tips.description: Describes when a great idea comes suddenly, often when least expected.
Tips.example: In the shower, I had an inspiration for my novel's ending.

senses.de: A sudden brilliant or timely idea

Tips.title: Spark of Genius
Tips.description: Used to express when an idea is seen as exceptionally clever or original.
Tips.example: Einstein's theory of relativity was a true inspiration in physics.

senses.de: The drawing in of breath; inhalation
senses.ex: In patients with asthma, inspiration may be laboured.

Tips.title: Medical Term
Tips.description: In a medical context, it specifically refers to the process of taking air into the lungs.
Tips.example: The doctor checked if my inspiration was normal during the check-up.

Tips.title: Not Metaphorical
Tips.description: Unlike other meanings, in medical terms, it's a literal and physical action.
Tips.example: Asthma patients may find inspiration difficult during an attack.

Creativity.wordDefinition:
Creativity is the ability to come up with new and original ideas, while inspiration is the trigger or spark that ignites those ideas.

In other words, creativity is the skill or talent to create something new, whereas inspiration is the thing that motivates or influences that creation.

Creativity can be applied to many things like art, writing, music, and innovation, where one can use their imagination to create something from scratch.

In conclusion, creativity is the skill, and inspiration is the motivating force that fuels that skill.

Encourage.wordDefinition:
Encourage means to give someone confidence or support and to motivate them to keep going towards their goal even when it's tough.

For example: My parents encouraged me to keep studying for my exams even when I felt like giving up.

Both words are positive and can be used to motivate someone to achieve their goals, but encourage focuses more on the support and motivation to keep going, while inspiration focuses more on the creativity or imagination that someone can draw from in order to achieve their goals.

Impetus.wordDefinition:
Impetus refers to a force that causes something to start or happen.

It can be thought of as a push or a motivation to get something done. For example, a student may receive an impetus to study harder after receiving a low grade on a test.

Impetus is applicable when talking about something that requires a push to start or get going, while inspiration is used when talking about something that requires creativity or a new idea.

Influence.wordDefinition:
Influence means to impact or affect someone or something, often in a powerful way.

Influence refers to the ability to change or shape someone's thoughts, beliefs, and actions.

Influence refers to the impact one has on others, while inspiration refers to the process of being motivated and excited by something.

Influence can be both positive and negative, while inspiration is generally seen as a positive force that leads to creativity and productivity.

Innovate.wordDefinition:
Innovate means to come up with a new idea or invent something that hasn't existed before. It is applicable when someone is trying to create something new or improve upon something that already exists.

Innovate refers to the creation of something new, while inspiration refers to the feeling that motivates that creation process.

Motivate.wordDefinition:
Motivate means to give someone a reason to take action toward a specific goal or outcome.

The main difference is that inspiration is about ideas and creative thinking, while motivation is about taking action and working towards a specific goal.

Both are important and applicable in different situations. For example, a teacher might inspire her students with a new and exciting class project, while a coach might motivate his team to work hard and win a game.

Spark.wordDefinition:
Spark refers to a sudden burst of energy or excitement that can help someone start something new or make a change.

A spark is typically seen as a more immediate and short-term source of motivation.

Both words can be applicable in different situations. For example, a writer might find inspiration from reading a book or observing people, while a person trying to get motivated to exercise might need a spark to get started.

Inspiration tends to be more long-lasting and deeper, while a spark tends to be more immediate and surface level.

Stimulus.wordDefinition:
Stimulus refers to an external factor or event that triggers a response or reaction from an individual.

It is often used in the context of physical or physiological responses to external stimuli such as light, sound, or touch.

Stimulus is a more scientific and objective term and is often used in research or experimentation.

Inspiration is a source of creative ideas and thoughts that come from within, while stimulus is an external force or trigger that causes a physical or mental response.

quotes.Text: Youth is the period in which a man can be hopeless. The end of every episode is the end of the world. But the power of hoping through everything, the knowledge that the soul survives its adventures, that great inspiration comes to the middle-aged.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.Text: Sometimes I write about my own life. And sometimes I write about situations I see my friends going through. Sometimes I write about a scene I saw in a movie. I take inspiration from all different places.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Taylor Swift

quotes.Text: It is a fact often observed, that men have written good verses under the inspiration of passion, who cannot write well under other circumstances.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.Text: The most inspirational person in my life has been my mother.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Nicole Maines

quotes.Text: I adore my dad. He's a 78-year-old man and my inspiration.
quotes.Title: Musician
quotes.Name: Shakira

quotes.Text: My inspiration are the woman, friendship, and loneliness.
quotes.Title: Spanish Musician
quotes.Name: Enrique Iglesias

quotes.Text: In life you need either inspiration or desperation.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Tony Robbins

quotes.Text: The natural world is a source of inspiration.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: Giles Deacon

quotes.Text: I get inspiration from my everyday life.
quotes.Title: Japanese Director
quotes.Name: Hayao Miyazaki
